header.title: RAWN'S SELF-HEALING ARCHAEOUS ~ Lesson Six ~ Elemental Balancing and Re-integration of the Three Bodies.

central_thesis: This lesson from Rawn Clark's Self-Healing Archaeous provides an advanced extension of Bardon's Hermetic practices, enabling profound Elemental balancing and re-integration across the mental, astral, and physical bodies. By systematically loading and releasing Elements within each body and carefully transferring the resulting harmony during re-integration, practitioners achieve a deep, holistic state of Elemental equilibrium, identified as the most healing level of the Archaeous.

structure_content.chapter_title: ~ Lesson Six ~ Elemental Balancing and Re-integration of the Three Bodies.
structure_content.summary: This lesson outlines a specific advanced meditative practice for Elemental balancing and re-integration. It requires prior mastery of body separation and Elemental accumulation as taught in Bardon's "Initiation Into Hermetics" (Step Four) and Lesson Five of Archaeous. The practice proceeds by separating the mental, astral, and physical bodies, then sequentially performing Elemental balancing within the solitary mental body, followed by the astral body, and finally the physical body. Each balancing involves filling specific Elemental regions with their respective Elements without condensation, meditating on the integrated balance, and then releasing the Elements in reverse order. Crucially, between each body's balancing, a careful re-integration process occurs where the Elemental harmony from the refined body is consciously transferred to the next, lower body, ensuring a holistic equilibrium across the entire being.

key_concepts.definition: A self-healing system developed by Rawn Clark, presented as an audio version script, which extends and builds upon the magical practices outlined in Franz Bardon's "Initiation Into Hermetics" (IIH).
Refers to the mental, astral, and physical bodies of the practitioner. The practice involves their separation, individual balancing, and subsequent re-integration.

The process of accumulating specific Elemental energies (Earth, Water, Air, Fire) into their corresponding regions within each of the three bodies to achieve a state of internal equilibrium. Emphasis is placed on 'filling' the regions rather than 'condensing' the Elements, and using equal amounts.

The precise and conscious process of reuniting the separated bodies (mental into astral, then astra-mental into physical) after Elemental balancing. This step is critical for transferring the achieved Elemental harmony from a higher body into a lower body.

The desired state of equilibrium and balance among the four Elements within a single body or across the fully integrated three bodies. This state is associated with feelings of peace, happiness, and profound self-healing.

Specific areas or 'regions' within each body (mental, astral, and physical) that are symbolically or functionally associated with a particular Element. For example, the 'cord connecting astral and physical bodies' is the Earth region of the mental body, and the 'leg region' is the Earth region of the physical body.

Franz Bardon's foundational text in Hermetic magic. Rawn Clark's Archaeous Lesson Six is explicitly presented as an extension of an exercise found at the end of the astral training of Step Four in IIH.

practical_system.description: The practical system detailed in Lesson Six is a sequential, multi-stage process for achieving Elemental balance and re-integration across the mental, astral, and physical bodies. It emphasizes precise separation, non-condensing Elemental accumulation in specific body regions, meditative integration, reverse-order Elemental release, and careful re-integration with conscious transfer of achieved harmony. The entire process is internal and relies on visualization, concentration, and conscious will, culminating in a state of deep, integrated Elemental harmony for self-healing.
rituals: Follow the Archaeous process to separate all three bodies (mental, astral, physical) and establish awareness solely within the solitary mental body.
Focus on the cord connecting astral and physical bodies (Earth region of mental body) and fill it with the Earth Element, without condensing, just enough to fill the cord.
Focus on the cord connecting resting astral and solitary mental body (Water region of mental body) and fill it with an equal amount of the Water Element, without condensing.
Focus on the Air region of the solitary mental body and fill it with an equal amount of the Air Element, without condensing.
Focus on the Fire region of the solitary mental body and fill it with an equal amount of the Fire Element, without condensing.
Spread awareness throughout the entire mental body, meditating in this state of integrated balance for several moments.
Release the accumulated Elements from the mental body in reverse order (Fire, then Air, then Water, then Earth).
Sense the Elemental harmony and balance within the mental body.
Gently sink into the reclining astral body, regain full awareness, and consciously permeate it, intimately linking astral and mental bodies.

Stand up with the astral-mental body, reconnecting with all astral sensations. Integrate astral and mental bodies, consciously vitalizing the astral body with the Elemental Equilibrium of the mental body. Be thorough in transferring the balancing influence.
Once fully reclaimed, focus on the Earth region of the astral body and fill it with the Earth Element (without condensing).
Fill the Water region of the astral body with an equal amount of the Water Element.
Fill the Air region of the astral body with an equal amount of the Air Element.
Fill the Fire region of the astral body with an equal amount of the Fire Element.
Spread awareness throughout the entire astral body, meditating in this state of integrated balance for several moments.
Release the accumulated Elements from the astral body in reverse order (Fire, then Air, then Water, then Earth).
Sense the Elemental harmony and balance within the astral body.

Turn focus to the resting physical body and re-integrate the astral-mental body with it. Spend moments consciously integrating the Elemental harmony of the astra-mental body into every aspect of the physical body, being as thorough as possible.
Once fully reclaimed, focus on the leg region of the physical body and fill it with the Earth Element (without condensing).
Fill the abdominal region of the physical body with an equal amount of the Water Element.
Fill the chest region of the physical body with the Air Element.
Fill the head region of the physical body with the Fire Element.
Spread awareness throughout the entire physical body, meditating in this state of integrated balance for several moments.
Release the accumulated Elements from the physical body in reverse order (Fire, then Air, then Water, then Earth).

Sense the Elemental harmony and balance within the physical-astra-mental body. Concentrate on the sensations of this re-vivified Equilibrium, integrating astral-mental energy into every cell of the physical body.
Release whatever excess energy remains.

Visualize the mental body actively brightening and directing the astral; visualize the physical conforming its structure to the renewed astral template. Pursue this final integration and balancing with utmost care and concentration.
End the meditation in the usual manner, returning to normal, waking consciousness.

relevant_quotes.text: This Lesson is suitable only for those who have made good headway with the work of Step Four of IIH and are already proficient with accumulating the Elements.
Mastery of Lesson Five is an absolute prerequisite for the pursuit of this Lesson since the Elemental balancing work requires a separation of the three bodies.
This Lesson of the Archaeous is an extension of an exercise found at the end of the astral training of Step Four in "Initiation Into Hermetics".
Achieving the fully integrated and Elementally balanced physical-astra-mental body is the most healing level of the Archaeous.

To quote Bardon, "If the magician should ever get into disharmony through any particular circumstances, all he has to do is practice these exercises and he will immediately redress the harmony. He will experience the comforting influence of the entire universal harmony, which is creating and keeping in him the feeling of peace and happiness, not only for a few hours, but for days."

critical_analysis.relevance: This lesson from Rawn Clark is highly relevant for practitioners engaged in the Hermetic tradition, particularly those following Franz Bardon's system. It provides an advanced, practical methodology for applying Elemental magic at the level of the subtle bodies (mental and astral) before integrating it into the physical. By extending Bardon's physical body Elemental balancing to the entire tripartite being, it offers a more holistic and potentially profound path to inner harmony and self-healing. The emphasis on careful re-integration ensures that the work done on higher planes directly impacts and transforms the lower, making it a critical step for comprehensive energetic purification and balancing within a Hermetic framework.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists of advanced practitioners of Hermetic magic. Specifically, individuals who have successfully completed the Elemental accumulation and body separation exercises outlined in Step Four of Franz Bardon's "Initiation Into Hermetics" and have mastered the prerequisite body separation techniques from Lesson Five of the Self-Healing Archaeous. This is not a beginner-level practice.
